Package fr.ensimag.deca.syntax

Class AbstractDecaLexer

java.lang.Object
org.antlr.v4.runtime.Recognizer<Integer,​org.antlr.v4.runtime.atn.LexerATNSimulator>
org.antlr.v4.runtime.Lexer
fr.ensimag.deca.syntax.AbstractDecaLexer
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.antlr.v4.runtime.TokenSource
Direct Known Subclasses:
DecaLexer
public abstract class AbstractDecaLexer extends org.antlr.v4.runtime.Lexer
This is the super class for the lexer. It is extended by the lexer class generated from DecaLexer.g.
Version:
$Id: $Id
Author:
gl20, Based on template by Jim Idle - Temporal Wave LLC (jimi@idle.ws)

    • getSourceName

      public String getSourceName​(org.antlr.v4.runtime.RecognitionException e)
      If e is linked to an input stream, return the source name for this stream. Otherwise (e.g. user-defined RecognitionException that do not set the input field), return the source name for this Lexer.
      Parameters:
      e - a RecognitionException object
      Returns:
      a String object

    • debugTokenStream

      public boolean debugTokenStream()
      Display the list of tokens for the lexer in semi-human-readable form. This consumes the stream of tokens, hence should never be called if the parser has to read these tokens afterwards.
      Returns:
      true if the lexer raised an error.

    • createLexerFromArgs

      public static DecaLexer createLexerFromArgs​(String[] args) throws IOException
      Helper for test drivers, that creates a lexer from command-line arguments.
      Parameters:
      args - Either empty (read from stdin), or 1-element array (the file to read from)
      Returns:
      The lexer built from args
      Throws:
      IOException

    • getSource

      protected File getSource()

      Getter for the field source.

      Returns:
      a File object

    • findFile

      org.antlr.v4.runtime.CharStream findFile​(String name) throws IOException, IncludeFileNotFound
      Look up the file to include in the current directory, or in the $CLASSPATH (either a file or the content of a .jar file).
      Returns:
      An ANTLR stream to read from
      Throws:
      IOException - when the file was found but could not be opened
      IncludeFileNotFound - when the file was not found.

    • doInclude

      void doInclude​(String includeDirective) throws IncludeFileNotFound, CircularInclude
      Apply a #include directive. Look up the file "name" using findFile(String), and set the input stream of the lexer to this object. The previous input stream is saved an includes and will be restored by nextToken().
      Throws:
      IncludeFileNotFound - When the file could not be found or opened.
      CircularInclude - When an attempt to perform a circular inclusion is done

    • nextToken

      public org.antlr.v4.runtime.Token nextToken()
      Override method nextToken for #include management.
      Specified by:
      nextToken in interface org.antlr.v4.runtime.TokenSource
      Overrides:
      nextToken in class org.antlr.v4.runtime.Lexer
